title: India records over 2 lakh new Covid-19 cases in 24 hours, more than 1,000 deaths reported for second consecutive day
description: With 200,739 fresh Covid-19 cases, the highest spike in a day, the total tally crossed the 14 million mark.

title: 3 wrestlers among 10 test Covid-19 positive day after natl women’s camp is shut
description: Wrestlers Pinki, Gurpreet and Indu, a physio and nursing staff member tested positive. Five mess staff are also reportedly asymptomatic. On Tuesday, SAI shut the women’s camp in Lucknow—no Tokyo-bound wrestler was in the camp. The men’s camp in Sonepat, Haryana also was closed.

description: Chandigarh: Haryana’s health and home minister Anil Vij on Wednesday categorically ruled out the imposition of lockdown in the state in the wake of fr.

title: With 71% spike, Haryana forays into uncharted territory — 5,398 cases
description: On Monday,  Haryana had recorded 3,818 fresh cases, which was till then the highest single-day figure since the pandemic outbreak last year.

title: Chadha writes to Haryana CM on water supply
description: Vice-Chairman of Delhi Jal Board, Raghav Chadha, on Wednesday wrote to the Haryana Chief Minister on “significant” reduction in raw water supplied by the State to Delhi and “frequent” high levels of a

title: With 5,398 new Covid cases, Haryana records highest ever single-day jump
description: Haryana continued to report a huge spike in Covid-19 cases with the state on Wednesday recording 5,398 fresh cases, the highest ever single-day surge since the pandemic broke out last year

title: Amid farmers’ protest threats, Haryana CM, Dushyant give Ambedkar Jayanti events a miss
description: The boycott call given by the agitating farmers against BJP-JJP leaders forced Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar to cancel his visit to Jat community-dominated Sonepat, where he was to attend a function of the BJP to mark Ambedkar Jayanti and inaugurate some developmental projects

title: Haryana ‘not moving towards a lockdown’, says deputy CM Dushyant Chautala
description: Adding that “no industrial activity” will be stopped in the state, the deputy CM said that citizens have to only stop their work at 10 pm “so that at least the movement in the evening that was causing a chain of spreading gets cut down a bit.”

title: Haryana stops wheat procurement in 18 grain markets
description: More than 10,000 farmers from neighbouring states like UP have also registered on the Haryana portal to sell their wheat crop.

title: Haryana: Woman Alleges Husband, In-Laws Repeatedly Harassed Her for Dowry Despite Reconciliation Efforts
description: A woman has alleged that her husband and in-laws repeatedly harassed her for dowry, abuse and beat her up, despite police intervention. A resident of Haryana's Kalka, the woman was married to a Patiala based man in 2016, and after continuous harassment left the house the following year only to reunite with her husband again in 2018 in police's presence.

title: Why Haryana CM Khattar's Karnal constituency is facing a Covid crisis
description: While Haryana is battling sharp spike in cases, situation in Karnal, which has 12-14% positivity rate, is worse. District officials say proximity to Punjab, location on GT road are factors.

title: Antipsychotics can lower COVID infection, severity risk: Study
description: Patients treated with antipsychotic drugs have a lower risk of becoming infected or suffer a milder form of SARS-CoV-2 -- the virus causing COVID-19 -- if they get infected, according to a study

title: Coronavirus India live updates: Uttar Pradesh records highest-ever single-day spike of 18,021 cases
description: Coronavirus update: India reported over 1.60 lakh new Covid-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union health ministry. Meanwhile, Haryana became the latest state to impose a night curfew to stop the spread of Covid. In Maharashtra, the govt is planning a lockdown but is right now finalising the details about what activities to be allowed and its duration. Delhi meanwhile reporterd over 11,000 cases, its highest surge so far.

title: Covid-19 lockdown in Bhopal, Haryana night curbs begin
description: While a complete week-long lockdown was announced in Madhya Pradesh capital Bhopal, the Haryana government decided to impose night curfew across the state.

title: Haryana’s private school owners protest restriction on physical classes of Class 1-8
description: Agitated over government’s decision to suspend classes for students of Classes 1 to 8 till April 30 due to rising Covid-19 cases, members of private school association held protests at the district headquarters

title: ‘Haryana to conduct board exams on time’
description: The Board of School Education Haryana (BSEH) has made all preparation to hold Class 10 and 12 board examinations which will start on April 22 and April 20, respectively, amid rise in Covid-19 cases, said board secretary Rajiv Prasad

title: Top 10 Covid updates: Haryana imposes night curfew, Kerala announces fresh curbs amid surge in cases
description: A look at the biggest developments of the day.

title: Haryana registers 3,440 new COVID-19 cases, 16 more fatalities
description: The COVID-19 death toll in Haryana reached 3,268 on Sunday with 16 more fatalities, while 3,440 fresh cases pushed the infection tally to 3,16,881, a health department bulletin said.

title: India believes in the idea of 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam': Haryana CM Khattar tells India TV
description: Don't want to comment on what Rahul Gandhi says. Coronavirus is a worldwide pandemic and under such circumstances, narrow-minded thinking is wrong. We have provided vaccine to several small countries or our neighbouring nations as India believes in the idea of 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' (the world is one family), Haryana CM Khattar said.

title: Schools, anganwadis and crèches to remain closed till April 30: Haryana govt
description: The Haryana government on Saturday directed the closure of all government and private schools up to class 8 till April 30, to curb the spread of coronavirus in the state

title: COVID: 11 fatalities, 2,937 new cases in Haryana
description: Haryana reported 11 COVID-19 fatalities on Saturday which took the death toll to 3,252, while 2,937 fresh cases pushed the tally to 3,13,441 in the state, a health department bulletin said.

title: Only 8 days gone in April, Haryana cases breach projected figures for month-end
description: The government had projected that the number of active cases were likely to reach 14,800-mark by April 30. However, as of April 7 (Wednesday), the number of active cases in Haryana stood at 15,237.

title: 2,872 new COVID-19 cases in Haryana
description: The tally rose to 3.08 lakh with 2,872 new infections, the highest since November 20 Haryana recorded the highest daily spike in over four months on Thursday as 2,872 more people tested positive for coronavirus, the Health Department said.

title: Haryana to vaccinate 35 lakh by April end
description: Haryana health minister, Anil Vij, on Wednesday said by April end, efforts will be made to vaccinate about 35 lakh people in the state. So far, about 21 lakh people have been vaccinated for Covid-19 in Haryana.

title: 2,366 fresh Covid-19 cases, 11 more deaths in Haryana
description: The total number of COVID-19 cases in Haryana surged to 3,04,638 on Wednesday as 2,366 more people tested positive for the disease while the death toll climbed to 3,219 with 11 new fatalities

description: A total of 3,033 against a target of 2,200 were vaccinated in the district on Thursday. Those vaccinated included frontline and healthcare workers.

Haryana records 1,609 fresh COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths
description: The number of active cases in Haryana stands at 10,362 Haryana recorded 1,609 fresh COVID-19 cases on Thursday that took its tally to 2,92,409, while nine more fatalities pushed the death toll to 3,164, a health department bulletin said.
